learning_outcomes.description: Describe an abstract model of a quantum computer.
Explain how quantum algorithms are constructed, and describe some examples that relate to cryptographic applications.
Describe the fundamental quantum computational complexity classes, and explain how they relate to classical complexity classes such as P and NP.
Describe different ways in which topics from classical computing, coding and cryptography can be adapted to the world of quantum computing.

assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description: Each assignment requires you to solve a set of problems given in class, and toÂ submit your written solutions through Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The final exam will test knowledge and problem solving skills from across the content of the course.

The exam will be open-book, and will be centrally scheduled and invigilated.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(28 Jul - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Reading and homework problems

Before and after each lecture and applied class you are expected to be reading text and other suggested sources for deeper understanding of the material, and trying all homework problems set. This is essential to understand and pass this course -- lectures and applied classes alone will not teach you everything you need to know, you are expected to be self-learners in this course.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(28 Jul - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures The lectures will be presented face-to-face.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(04 Aug - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Applied Classes

Applied classes will involve working through homework problems as a group, in order to consolidate the lecture material and work together on difficult problem solving tasks.
